titleStmt.title: Put A Curse On My Enemy

sourceDesc.p: This poem appears on ff. 116r in MSS Vat.ebr.402
Written in Hebrew, with Ashkenazic semi-cursive scripts.

handDesc.p: Written in at least four distinct hands.
This poem was written by a scribe who gave no attribution to themselves.

custodialHist.p: Manuscript was written and compiled approximately in 1300.
There is no history of the manuscript between this earliest date and 1887, when the manuscript was discovered in the Vatican Library by Abraham Berliner.

lg.l: Put a curse on my enemy, for all deceive their brothers,
When will You say to the house of Jacob, “Come let us walk in the light."
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
Rend their closed hearts, they who brought harm to those who come in your name,
I waited for good and evil arrived, yet I hoped for light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
The words of the seers’ were careless, for the foe has mocked Your children,
Until he no longer knew which path lead to the light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
In the land of heavy-hearted and exhausted, men’s reproachful voices are heard,
And we are silent and await the light.
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
They make heavy our yoke, they are finishing us off.
Always we will be told, “We will disgrace them until the light.”
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
Then let their victory stain Your garment, Your beloved’s heart is aflame,
But she will be consoled, Her Lords remains until the light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
Have you forgotten to be merciful, my G-d,? When will you gather your camps,
Scattered to the corners of the Earth, as infants who have yet to see the light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
Let the King restore His banished one, let Him smell the scent of the offering,
The foes who foul the scent, never will they see the light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
And if You increased Israel’s affliction, be abundant in your benevolence to him,
For he despairs of his dwelling place, on your paths shines the light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
And if his vision he has delayed, the appointed time has passed,
Let them release their hold on us, one and all, until the light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
If the vision is hidden, and his dreams have no interpreter,
Why should the glorious crown remain with the wicked until the light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
Even if his sins are intemperate, why do his enemies wage war,
They whose mouths have spoken arrogantly, they rebel against the light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
They scattered him with their horns, he hoped in hidden prophesies,
The seers have sealed themselves, and do not know the light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
Evil men have knocked down his crown, hoping to annihilate him,
They cast him into the prison, and in darkness he hoped for light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
Raise him up before his end, before he is lost in exile,
They boast of his annihilation, they treat the darkness as light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
He has been waiting always, day after day, for his consolation,
Mighty and Awesome One in Heaven, who brings justice into the light,
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
If you have given me unto my enemies, arise and plead my cause,
Establish the Messiah’s reign, and in Your light will it be seen.
Mighty are you and full of light, the darkness You will turn to light.
